entry.body: Contact your local dealer who will remove your old Volvo On Call PIN-Code. To create a new PIN-Code, press the On Call button in your car. You will be provided support by an operator at the Volvo On Call customer service centre. Tell the operator the new PIN-Code you wish to use for your account.
entry.title: How do I change my Volvo On Call PIN-Code?

entry.body:
Volvo On Call is a built-in assistance service, featuring a ground breaking mobile app that puts you in constant touch with your Volvo. Lock the doors, find your car, view your dashboard and set the heater by the touch of a button. By using your smartphone, you can communicate with your Volvo and control it wherever you are.  

Volvo is the first car manufacturer in the world to offer this kind of app for iPhone, Android and Windows phones. The app is available for cars of model 2012 or later. If you want to try it out, just download it for free from Apple AppStore, Google Play or Windows Phone Market Place and test it in the demo mode.  

Learn more about the mobile app features:

Find your car

Forgot where you parked? The Volvo On Call mobile app will show you the location of your car on a high-definition map and provide you with directions. You can also ask your car to honk and/or flash so that you can find it more easily.

Lock and unlock your car

Wonder if you really locked your car? No need to walk back and check, The Volvo On Call mobile app lets you lock and unlock your car remotely. You can also check if windows and doors are open or closed.

Check the dashboard

With the Volvo On Call mobile app you can read your car’s dashboard remotely. You will see if something needs to be attended to, for example if a bulb is broken or if your washer fluid is low. The app also gives remote access to information on fuel level, average fuel consumption and distance to empty tank. Never again will you wonder if you have sufficient fuel for tomorrow morning’s drive.

Heat your car

No need to ever enter a cold car in the morning again. The Remote Heater Start can be set and started from the comfort of your house, or from any other place. Just tell your car when you want to set off and the app and the heater does the rest.

Log your trips

With the Volvo On Call mobile app you have an automated driving journal in your pocket. You get all your trips on record and it is possible to transfer the data to Excel – a perfect feature for company car owners. You can also choose to see your recorded trips on a map and access graphs on speed and fuel consumption for specific time intervals. With the app it is also possible to plan your trips from the comfort of your home. Search for a destination and send it to your car for the route to appear in your car’s navigation system.

For plugin hybrids

Plug-in hybrid owners get all the standard Volvo on Call features plus a range of added benefits that will make the hybrid ownership much more convenient. For example, you can check your battery level remotely, find the nearest charging station and get reminders when you’re low on voltage.

Additional functionalities

Wondering what the temperature is like where you left your car? Using web based weather information you can check the temperature forecast of your car’s location in your Volvo On Call app. In the app you also find basic vehicle information, such as model and fuel tank volume.

From the app you can also see the status of your Volvo On Call subscription, change your app login details and manage your account. Please see availability and technical requirements for more information on what services that are available on your market and for your specific car and smart phone. Learn more about how to get started with the Volvo On Call app.
entry.title: Mobile app

entry.body: As of September 2012, Volvo On Call is available as an option on all Volvo cars sold in Sweden, UK, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Italy, Norway, Spain, France, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Russia, Denmark, Finland and Brazil. In Portugal services are available from a customer service center located in one of the other countries.
entry.current-tags: availability call countries markets on voc volvo
entry.title: In which countries is Volvo On Call available?

entry.body:
The mobile app is available for cars of year 2012 or later and includes a number of features. These vary depending on model year and car type, see chart below:

 [Insert chart from product guide when OK from Stendahls]

parking heater.

entry.title: What services are available for my car?

entry.body: Yes. You can download the app from Apple AppStore, Google Play or Windows Phone MarketPlace for free. You can also test it in the demo mode, this does not require a Volvo On Call subscription.
entry.current-tags: app charge cost fee free pay started
entry.title: Is the Volvo On Call app free of charge?

entry.body:
Contact the Volvo On Call customer service center by one of the following methods:
• Press the On Call button in your car.
• Use the assistance function in your Volvo On Call mobile application.
• Dial the number corresponding to the Volvo On Call customer service center in your home country. Please see  Volvo On Call customer service centers for contact details. The numbers are also found in your Volvo On Call manual.

You will be in contact with a Volvo On Call operator who will provide suitable assistance.
entry.current-tags: assistance button call help on roadside safety
entry.title: My car has Volvo On Call. How do I access roadside assistance?

entry.body:
This can be one of two things:
• The current location of your vehicle has bad or no GPS line of sight, e.g. if located in a parking garage. In this case, the last received position will be used to approximate a position.
• Volvo On Call uses GPS technology to locate your car. The GPS coordinates is translated to addresses that can be easily understood, e.g. street names. These are called “strong positions”. E.g. parking lots are usually not defined as strong positions, and therefore it might look like your car is parked on a nearby street.
entry.title: Why does the app show the wrong position of my car?

entry.body:
First, download the Volvo On Call app from Apple AppStore, Google Play or Windows Phone MarketPlace. Make sure you have the car’s registration number and the Volvo On Call PIN-Code that you selected at your dealer available. Position your car outside and control that your phone has coverage. Put yourself in the driving seat and turn on your Volvo's ignition. The engine does not need to be started. After making these preparations, follow the steps below:

1) On the Volvo On Call mobile application starting page, select 'Create an account'.
2) Provide the required information.
3) Press the On Call button in your car to validate the account. For security purposes you will be required to push the On Call button in your car within 2 minutes of the account’s creation so that a link can be established between the car and your phone.

For more detailed information please see Get started with the Volvo On Call app.
entry.title: How do I connect the Volvo On Call app with my car?

entry.body: Please press the On Call button in your car or call the number of the Volvo On Call customer service center in your home country, available 24/7. You will be in contact with a Volvo On Call operator who will temporarily disable your account. To enable it again you will be required to go to 'Create an account' in the application process. All your account data and settings will be retrieved.
entry.title: I have lost my phone. How do I disable my Volvo On Call account?

entry.body: You can change your password directly from your Volvo On Call app. Go to the “Settings” menu. Select “My account” and “Change password”. The password must be 6-20 characters and contain at least one numeric character and at least one alphabetic character.
entry.title: How do I change the password to my Volvo On Call account?

entry.body: Please contact your local dealer.
entry.title: How do I renew my subscription?

entry.body:
Owners of cars of model year 2011 and later will have a notification message inside the car 45 days before the subscription ends saying “On Call subscription will soon expire”.

For cars produced before 2011 there is no notification possible from the car. You need to to contact your dealer for this information.

Will I be notified if my subscription is about to expire?I receive notifications that my subscription is about to expire, what do I have to do?
entry.title: Will I be notified if my subscription is about to expire?

entry.body: There are two heaters in your car: one cabin heater which you control yourself (either in the car or via the Volvo On call app) and one auxiliary heater. The auxiliary heater is as default active when you buy a new car and it will always try to start when you turn on the engine. If the auxiliary heater is not allowed to start (e.g. low fuel level) it will be shown in the mobile app.
entry.title: I received a pop up saying my heater could not be started, although I have not tried to activate it.

entry.body: It indicates a malfunction on the car. You should refer to the owner manual or contact your dealer.
entry.title: I have a red warning. What should I do?

entry.body: Yes, you can disable the journal log using the Volvo On call mobile app. Enter the "Settings" menu, choose "My Volvo" and deselect the Driving journal-option. When disabled, no data will be sent from the car.
entry.title: Can I disable the journal log function?

entry.body: Trips less than 100m will not be counted as a trip.
entry.title: I drove a short distance but no trip was shown in my app, why?

entry.body: No, this feature is currently not implemented.
entry.title: Can I monitor more than one Volvo with the same account?

entry.body:
You can enter a faulty password 15 times in a row before your Volvo On Call app account is locked.
To be able to log in to your account again you need to recreate it by entering "Create account" from the first page of the mobile app. You can use the same user name and password as last time (you can also choose a new password).
entry.title: How many times can I enter the wrong password?

entry.body: If you enter a faulty Volvo On Call PIN-Code ten times in a row when trying to create new app accounts connected to your car, the possibility to add new users will be removed. Though, the existing accounts can still be used. To be able to create new accounts again you will need a new PIN-Code. For this you will need to contact your local dealer.
entry.current-tags: account attempts code create password pin pin-code wrong
entry.title: What happens if I enter the wrong PIN-Code when adding a user account?

entry.body: Contact your local Volvo dealer. You need to identify yourself as the owner of the car. The dealer will erase data from the previous owner and add your details, if this has not already been done. Press the On Call button in your car and provide your choice of personal 4-digit PIN code to the operator. This enables you to download and activate the Volvo On Call mobile app (if the car is of year model 2012 or later).
entry.title: I have bought a used car with Volvo On Call, what should I do?

entry.body: The Volvo On Call customer service centers are available 24/7.
entry.title: When are the Volvo On Call customer service centers open?

entry.body: The data is visible from all the accounts that you have created for your car. Otherwise, the data is fully secured.
entry.title: Can someone else access my journal log?

entry.body:
In order to save the battery when the car is not being used for longer periods the Volvo On Call system has been set up to operate in the following way:

– First 72 hours (3 days) after the engine has been shut off: The system is continuously available and executes new requests immediately.

– From the 4th up to the 14th day after the engine has been shut off: The system wakes up every hour to check for new requests and execute them.

– After 14 days: The system turns to sleep mode and no mobile app functionality (e.g. the remote heater start and the remote lock and unlock features) requiring communication with the vehicle will be available. To be able to access the services again, restart the vehicle to upstart the system.
entry.title: What happens with the Volvo On Call system if I do not use my car for longer periods?

entry.body:
The Volvo On Call mobile app can be downloaded from the application stores Apple App Store, Google Play and Windows Market Place for free. You can also test it in the demo mode. This does not require the app to be connected to a specific vehicle. 

Create a Volvo On Call app account

When you have downloaded the app you need to create an account and connect it to your car.

Please note that to be able to create an account your Volvo needs to be of year model 2012 or later and equipped with the factory option Volvo On Call. You also need a valid Volvo On Call subscription and the four digit Volvo On Call PIN code that you selected at the time of activation of the Volvo On Call system when the car was delivered to you. If your subscription has expired you need to renew it by contacting your local dealer.

To succeed in creating an account, your car needs to be located in an open area with GSM-coverage, both to your phone and to your car.

Follow the instructions to create an account:  

  1. Before you create your account, make sure you have your vehicle registration number and your four-digit Volvo On Call PIN-Code available.
  2. Position your car outside in an open area and ensure that your mobile phone has coverage where you are.
  3. Put yourself in the driver's seat of your Volvo. Turn on your Volvo's ignition. The engine does not need to be started.
  4. On the app’s starting page, select "Create account". To continue, read and accept the terms and conditions.
  5. Enter the requested information: The car’s registration number, your Volvo On Call PIN-Code, your country, e- mail address and desired password. Your email address will serve as the username when logging into the app. The password must be at least 6-20 characters and contain at least one number and one letter. You can choose whether you want the app to remember your password for future logins. Be aware that if you changes mobile phone, this device will not remember the password. In case you have forgotten your password, you will need to go through the steps for creating an account again. This to ensure high security. To avoid this process, remember your password and keep it safe. Also note the e-mail address you chose as username.
  6. To validate your account, you must press the On Call button in your car within 2 minutes from the app account was created so that a link can be established between the car and the phone. If more than two minutes passes before you press the On Call button, the account creation will be interrupted and you will be in contact with a Volvo On Call operator as when making a regular assistance call. Tell the operator that you are creating an account. You will have to start from the beginning.

When your account has been created you are ready to explore the features of the Volvo On Call mobile app. Read more about how to manage your account.

If you have bought a used car equipped with Volvo On Call, see change owner for further instructions.

Log in view

When logging into the app you get a fast overview of the status of the most common features:

  • Distance to empty tank
  • Temperature at your Volvo’s location
  • Information on starting point, distance and duration for your latest trip
  • Open/closed status for doors, windows and trunk
  • Lock status
  • Current settings for your heater
  • Fuel level
  • Average fuel consumption

By pressing on the status icons you access the different features with more detailed information and possibilities to control them.

Recommendations on data plan

Your phone will download and send data over the internet when using the app. You are therefore recommended to have an unlimited data plan. Note that when operating the application from abroad you may be charged roaming costs. Please consult your mobile network operator for more information.
entry.title: Get started with the Volvo On Call app

entry.body:
General account settings
By pressing “Settings” from the log in view you are able to make general settings such as:

  • Set your preferred units (miles, km, etc.) and manage notifications (e.g. get notified if your car is unlocked) under “General”
  • Change username and password under “My account”. Here you also find the account expiration date and the account’s e-mail address.
  • Activate the driving journal and change owner under “My Volvo”. (For iOS phones you are also able to access information about your car from this view, please see further information below)

Add and remove users
For adding users to your account choose Settings -> My Volvo -> Manage accounts. You will need your Volvo On Call PIN code to be able to perform the command. Please note that settings made by one user will affect all users, e.g. deleting information from the journal log.

From the Manage accounts view you are also able to select and delete user accounts.

The number of users (e-mail addresses and password) connected to one car is maximum ten and the number of phones connected to one app account is unlimited. It is not yet possible to use one account for monitoring multiple vehicles.

If you enter a faulty PIN-Code ten times in a row when trying to create new app accounts connected to your car, the possibility to add new accounts will be removed. Though, the existing accounts can still be used. To be able to create new accounts again you will need a new PIN-Code.

Disable your account

In case you have lost your phone, it is possible to disable your account. Please press the On Call button in your car or call the number for your home country, available 24/7. You will be in contact with a Volvo On Call operator who will temporarily disable your account. To enable it again you will be required to go to 'Create an account' in the application process. All your account data and settings will be retrieved.

You can also delete your account from inside the app, chose settings -> My account -> Delete account for iOS phones. Android phones: Settings -> My Volvo -> Manage accounts. After deleting the account you will not be able to use the app. You need to recreate your account.  For this you will need a new PIN-code, contact your dealer who will help you.
entry.title: Manage your account

entry.body:
With the Volvo On Call mobile app you have an automated driving journal in your pocket. Information on all trips are collected and the trip info will be sent approx. 30s to one minute after the key has been removed.

Manage your journal log

From the journal log view you are able to name your trips and assign them to different categories (Business, private or unassigned). You can also add notes, such as how much you paid when you stopped to refuel. Information on duration, distance, fuel consumption and odometer is given for each trip. You can also see the start and stop times as well as the to and from addresses.

You are able to merge individual trips into a single trip, e.g. when taking a rest on a long journey or stopping at the petrol station. Trips can also be deleted. If you have several accounts connected to one vehicle you will all see the same view of the Volvo On Call data server. This means that if you delete one trip, rename or group trips on one phone it will take effect on all your users viewing the information.

The trips can be filtered according to categories and you also have the possibility to choose the displayed range according to time interval.

The journal log can be turned off from inside your mobile app from the My Volvo view under Settings. This will instruct the vehicle to stop sending journal log information at the end of each trip. None of the phones connected to your account will be able to see the journal log.

Export and use the data

It is possible to transfer the data from the journal log to other formats. This function can eg. be used to create business expense reports. Select the trips you wish to export and press the email symbol. You then have the possibility to e-mail the information in one of the following formats: Excel file, CSV file or text. The file attached to the e-mail can be saved and opened in e.g Microsoft Excel, Google Spreadsheets or Open Office Spreadsheet.

Trip Route

With the trip route function, the route of each trip is displayed on a map.

You can see where the car has been driven from the start until it stopped and the ignition was switched off. There is also a street view option available. This view shows graphs for speed and/or fuel consumption for specific time intervals.

For more information on what features of the journal log that are available for your specific car and phone, please see availability and technical requirements.
entry.title: Journal log

entry.body:
Volvo On Call is an integrated emergency and roadside assistance service, featuring a ground breaking mobile app that puts you in constant touch with your Volvo. With your car equipped with Volvo On Call, you are always secure. Using GPS positioning and on-board GSM connectivity, Volvo On Call is ready to help in case of theft, burglar alarms or if you have lost your car keys. Note that the security services available vary on different markets, please see availability and technical requirements for more information.  

Theft notification and tracking

If your car is stolen and the theft alarm is activated, a Volvo On Call operator will automatically receive a notification. The operator will first phone the vehicle’s integrated phone to determine that it is not a false alarm.  If it is not, the operator will phone the person who is listed as the driver of the vehicle and confirm that the car has been stolen.  If confirmation is given, a stolen vehicle tracking session will be initiated. You can also call the Volvo On Call center yourself and report a theft to initiate a tracking session. The car is tracked via satellite and remotely immobilized. The Volvo On Call operator will be able to determine the car’s location irrespective of whether it is being driven or transported by any other method. 

To make it easier to recover the car, it will be impossible to start the engine unless it is unblocked by the call center. The Track-and-Stop functionality can only be activated in consultation with the police, and the exact position of the car will only be provided to the police authorities. Please note that you as a customer must report the theft to the authorities yourself.  

The Volvo On Call hardware meets the strictest requirements for a stolen vehicle tracking device and should qualify you for insurance discounts if devices are recommended or required in your country.  

Lost your keys

If your car key is lost, or locked in the car, you can call the Volvo On Call customer service who will help you. You identify yourself as the owner by providing your Volvo On Call PIN-Code to the operator. Together you will agree on a time when the car doors should be opened. The number to the Volvo On call customer service in your country can be found in your Volvo On Call owner’s manual.  

For more information about Volvo On Call and how to access the security services, please contact your local dealer.
entry.title: Security services

entry.body: Apple iOS 5.0 or later, Android 2.1 or later, and Windows Phone 7.1 or later.  The mobile app is not developed for tablets, however some tablets/functions will work anyway.
entry.current-tags: android app availability ios ipad iphone mobile platform tablet voc windows
entry.title: What mobile platforms are supported?

entry.body:
The Volvo On Call service is included the first X* years when buying a new Volvo with the Volvo On Call factory option. After this time has passed, you can renew the subscription. Contact your dealer for price details.  

(*Varies depending on market)

Subscription status

If you want to know the end date of your subscription, log in to your Volvo On Call mobile app and choose "Settings" and "My account". Here you find information on when your subscription expires. If you don't have access to the app, please contact your local dealer. By using the VIN number of your car you can get information about the status of your subscription.

Renew your subscription

Renew your Volvo On Call subscription by visiting your dealer. You can choose between a one or a two year subscription extension.

Expired subscription

Owners of cars of model year 2011 and later will have a notification message inside the car 45 days before the subscription ends saying “On Call subscription will soon expire”. When the subscription time ends it will say “On Call Deactivated”. 14 days after the subscription time ran out the warning light will be shut off and the Volvo On Call unit is deactivated. Emergency service and Automatic Collision Alert will continue to function.  

For cars produced before 2011 there is no notification possible from the car. You need to to contact your dealer for this information.

End subscription

If your subscription expires and you do not want to prolong it, the Volvo On Call unit will be deactivated automatically. If you wish to end your subscription prematurely, contact your dealer. When selling a car, the subscription will be transferred to the new owner automatically.
entry.title: Manage your subscription

entry.body: Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, English, German, Brazilian Portuguese, French, Dutch, Italian, Spanish and Russian.
entry.current-tags: app availability country language market voc
entry.title: Which languages are supported in the mobile app?

entry.body: Yes. You can download the Volvo On Call app from Apple AppStore, Google Play or Windows Phone MarketPlace and test it in the demo mode. This does not require the app to be connected to a specific vehicle.
entry.current-tags: app demo free started test trial try voc
entry.title: Can I try the Volvo On Call app for free?

entry.body:
No need to ever enter a cold car in the morning again. The remote heater start function in your Volvo On Call mobile app lets you set and start the heater from the comfort of your house, or from any other place. This function requires the car to be equipped with a factory-mounted parking heater. Please see availability and technical requirements for more information on what services that are available for your specific car and phone. 

Direct start and heater status

You can start or stop the parking heater directly from the app. In the heater menu you are also able to see if your heater is currently running or not. To be able to start the heater, the exterior temperature needs to be under 15C and the car must have sufficient fuel (approximately 10 litres) and battery charge.  

Program your heater

You can program the heater to start at two different points of time within the next 24h. Set the time you want to leave and your car will calculate when the heater needs to start based on the exterior temperature. A direct maneuver will interrupt any scheduled timers.   

Read more about the added climate control options for owners of plugin hybrids. 

Outside temperature by your Volvo

With the Volvo On Call mobile app, it is possible to check the temperature at your Volvo’s current location. Using web-based weather information an outside temperature forecast is shown where the car is parked. The time displayed indicates which time the temperature is estimated for.
entry.title: Remote heater start

entry.body:
Wonder of you really locked your car? No need to walk back and check. The lock status view in your Volvo On Call mobile app provides a way to ensure that your car has been locked and that all doors and windows are fully closed. For some models it is also possible to get push notifications if your Volvo has been unlocked for more than 30 minutes. Activate notifications under Settings/General in the app. 

Lock your car

You can lock your car from the “Doors and locks” menu in the app. Locking your car will engage the alarm but not the deadlock, making it possible to open the vehicle from the inside for safety reasons. 

Unlock your car  

You can also unlock your car from the app. The application will always require the Volvo On Call PIN code to open the car remotely. To avoid accidental unlock of the car it requires someone to physically pull the handle of the luggage compartment in order for the vehicle to unlock itself. If this is not done within two minutes, the luggage compartment door will relock itself automatically. Note that there is a 5 to 10 second delay for the unlock instruction to be transmitted to the car via the GSM network. 

Unlock your car via the customer service center

You can also ask a Volvo On call operator to unlock your car by calling the Volvo On Call customer service center in your country. To be able to unlock your Volvo, you need to identify yourself as the owner of the car. You do this by providing your four-digit Volvo On Call PIN-Code.
The services available vary for different car models and phones, please see availability and technical requirements for more information.
entry.title: Lock and unlock your car

entry.body:
In the Volvo On Call mobile app you find basic information about your Volvo:

  • Fuel type      
  • Car model
  • Fuel tank volume
  • Gross vehicle weight
  • Model year
  • Number of doors
  • VIN number (Vehicle Identification Number)
  • Registration number

Depending on your type of phone, the car information is accessed from either the log in view (Android phones) or under Settings/My Volvo (iOS phones). You can chose your preferred units under "General" in the "Settings" menu.
entry.title: Vehicle information
System sleep mode

entry.body:
Volvo On Call is an integrated emergency and roadside assistance service, featuring a ground breaking mobile app that puts you in constant touch with your Volvo. Using GPS positioning and on-board GSM connectivity, Volvo On Call is ready to help, whenever you need it. The safety services of Volvo On Call include helps in the event of an accident, emergency or technical problems.  

Automatic Collision Alert

If an airbag deploys or safety belt pre-tensioners are activated during a collision, an alarm will automatically transmit to the Volvo On Call emergency centre. A trained Volvo On Call crisis manager will then direct police, ambulance services or other relevant assistance to your exact location and try to speak with you via the integrated telephone – providing calm assistance until help arrives.  

Emergency service – The SOS button

If you’re involved in an emergency, press the SOS button inside of your car. This puts you in direct contact with a trained Volvo On Call crisis manager who will ensure that immediate dispatch of police, ambulance or other relevant assistance is initiated. The crisis manager will transfer the position from the GPS system to the emergency service, and maintain contact with you until they arrive.  

Roadside assistance – The On Call button

By pressing the On Call button inside of your car, you reach a Volvo On Call operator who will guide a recovery service all the way to your car. You’ll get help fast if your car breaks down, you run out of fuel, get a flat tyre etc. To access roadside assistance, you can also use the assistance function in the Volvo On Call mobile app or call the Volvo On Call customer service center in your country. The Volvo On Call operation center is available 24/7.
The operator will be able to access information about the status of your car, such as battery charge and fuel level. Together you will agree on the most suitable assistance. Thanks to the GPS technology, help will be guided to your exact position. Roadside assistance is included the first X years, and can be extended with a renewable Volvo On Call subscription after that. ( X= Varies between different markets, contact your local dealer for more information)

 For more information about Volvo On Call and how to access the services, please contact your local dealer.

The extent of this service varies between different markets. Please see availability and technical requirements for more information.
entry.title: Safety services and assistance

entry.body:
Selling a car equipped with Volvo On Call

When selling a car equipped with Volvo On Call it is important to remove your information from the app. Proceed by logging in to your Volvo On Call mobile app. Press "Change owner" and enter your Volvo On Call PIN code. This will erase your service history, journal log entries and remote access accounts. If you do not have access to the mobile app, contact your local dealer who will remove your service history and journal log entries. 

If possible, inform your buyer that he/she should contact the dealer to reinitiate it. The Volvo On Call services will continue to function until the subscription end date. When you sell your car, the remaining time of your subscription will be transferred to the new owner. 

Buying a car equipped with Volvo On Call

If buying a used model year 12 car equipped with Volvo On Call, you need to make sure the previous owner's information is removed, add your details and chose a PIN-Code. Proceed as follows:

Contact your local Volvo dealer. You need to identify yourself as owner of the vehicle. If not already done, the dealer will erase data from the previous owner and add your details. Press the On Call button in your car and provide your choice of personal 4-digit PIN-Code to the operator.This enables you to download and activate the Volvo On Call mobile app.
entry.title: Change owner

entry.body:
With the Volvo On Call mobile app you can read your dashboard remotely. From the dashboard view, you are able to access information about:

  • Fuel level
  • Distance to empty tank
  • Average fuel consumption
  • Odometer
  • Average speed
  • Trip reading

Please note that the data from the car are collected from the vehicle one minute after the key has been removed from the key slot (i.e. this function does not provide real-time nor on-demand collection of dashboard values).

Warnings

In the dashboard view you can also receive warnings on:  

  • Break fluid
  • Bulb failures
  • Time for service
  • Tyre pressure
  • Washer fluid 

The severity of the warnings are indicated by color coding:

  • Red: Needs immediate attention
  • Yellow: Address as soon as possible
  • Green: No issue to adress
  • Grey: Status unknown 

To get appropriate instructions based on the type of warning received, please refer to the owner manual of your car or contact your dealer.
entry.title: Check your dashboard

entry.body: The app can be downloaded from Apple AppStore, Google Play and Windows Phone MarketPlace.
entry.current-tags: app apple appstore download google googleplay marketplace play started windows
entry.title: Where can I find the Volvo On Call app?

entry.body:
Forgot where you parked? The Volvo On Call mobile app includes a car locator function which provides a graphical map showing both the current position of the mobile device and the last known position of your car. There is also an option to get a guided navigation from where you are to where your Volvo is parked. 

The car locator function relies on GPS, which requires clear line of sight from the sky. In case your car is located e.g. in an underground parking garage, the app will show the last received position of the car.  

Honk and flash

Sometimes it can be difficult to navigate to the car’s exact position. To get extra help, you can use the honk and flash function which triggers the honk and/or flashing lights in your car for a few seconds so that you can easily locate it. The honk and flash function is also handy when the GPS technology it is not accurate enough to pinpoint the exact location of your vehicle, e.g. when searching for your car on a large parking lot. 

This function works within a radius of approximately 100m from your car.  

Send destination to your car

From the map view, you are able to search for a destination within a 50km radius and send it to your car. The position will show up in the car’s road and traffic information system inside of the car.  

A symbol of a car by the map indicates if the car has the send to car functionality. For more information about the services available for your specific car and phone, please see availability and technical requirements.
entry.title: Car locator

entry.body:
Log in to your Volvo On Call mobile app and choose “Settings” and “My account”. Here you will find the expiration date of your Volvo On Call subscription.

If you don't have access to the app, please contact your local dealer. By using the VIN number of your car you can get information about the status of your subscription.
entry.current-tags: date end end-date information status subscription
entry.title: Where do I find information about my subscription?

entry.body:
Drivers of Plugin Hybrids will have access to a number of smart functions via their Volvo On Call mobile app in addition to the standard features. The following benefits will make your hybrid ownership more convenient:

Check battery and charging status

Remotely check the battery level and how many kilometers you can drive on the current charge. The battery status in the high-voltage battery is shown graphically. You will also receive warnings if the charging is interrupted, e.g. in the event of a power cut. The warning comes as a message immediately when charging has stopped.

Find a charging point

The app helps you find the nearest charging point and gives you the possibility to save your top eight charging points in a favorite list. You can also add unique settings for your favorite charging points:  

  • Add a plugin reminder if you arrive close to a present favorite charging place without charging. The reminder is activated 30 minutes after charging would have been started and comes as a message in the phone.
  • Schedule charging (start and end time)

Control the climate

You can pre-heat and pre-cool your car remotely via the app. When the timer is set for pre-conditioning the passenger compartment will be conditioned at the time selected in the timer. Direct start interrupts the set countdown time. The car will heat up or cool down the interior cabin in its aspiration to reach the desired interior temperature. The desired temperature is the current setting on the climate system as set by you. All strictions/options are the same as for usual air conditioning

The additional features for plugin hybrid owners are currently available on iOS and Android phones. Please se availability and technical requirements for more information about the services available for your specific car and phone.
entry.title: For plugin hybrids

entry.body:
Markets and languages

To be able to use Volvo On call you need a Volvo equipped with the Volvo On Call factory option and a valid Volvo On Call subscription. As of September 2012, Volvo On Call is available as an option on all Volvo cars in Sweden, UK, The Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Italy, Norway, Spain, France, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Russia, Denmark, Finland and Brazil. In Portugal services are available from a customer service center located in one of the other countries.  

The app is available in Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, English, German, Brazil Portuguese, French, Dutch, Italian, Spanish and Russian. 

Phone requirements

The Volvo On Call mobile app is available for iPhone, Android and Windows mobile phones and can be downloaded free of charge via the application stores Apple AppStore, Google Play or Windows Phone MarketPlace. The app is supported by these mobile platforms:

  • Apple iOS 5.0 or later,
  • Android 2.1 or later
  • Windows Phone 7.1 or later. Note that the app is not supported by Windows Phone 256MB devices, such as the Nokia Lumia 610 and the ZTE Orbit.

The app has been developed for mobile phones only and even if it may work also in tablets, it has not been optimised for this and its function and appearance cannot be guaranteed.

Users of  Windows phones cannot yet access the plugin hybrid features nor the new functions in the latest release such as send destination to car, outside temperature at your car and trip route.

The app uses internet connectivity to communicate with the vehicle, therefore your communication device must have internet access to be able to perform your commands.

Requirements on your Volvo

To be able to use Volvo On call, your must be equipped with the Volvo On Call factory option. The Volvo On Call mobile app is available for cars of model year 2012 or later and includes a number of features.  These vary depending on the car model, see the chart below to find out what services that are available for your specific car.

 

[Insert table from product guide with updated information]

 

(1)   Please see Vehicle dashboard – data section for full details of what
information is accessible depending on the Volvo model.

(2)   This function requires your vehicle to be equipped with a factory-fitted
parking heater.

(3)   You can check if the doors and windows of your car are open or closed
but you cannot lock the doors remotely on the C30, C70, S40/V50. It is not possible to check the status or lock/unlock the doors on an XC90.
*) As of 12w40, not Windows Phone
**) Only V60 Plugin Hybrid, iPhone and Android.

System sleep mode

In order to save the battery when the car is not being used for longer periods the Volvo On Call system has been set up to operate in the following way:

– First 72 hours (3 days) after the engine has been shut off: the system is continuously available and executes new requests immediately.

– From the 4th up to the 14th day after the engine has been shut off: the system wakes up every hour to check for new requests and execute them.

– After 14 days: the system turns to sleep mode and no mobile app functionality (e.g. the remote heater start and the remote lock and unlock features) requiring communication with the vehicle will be available. To be able to access the services again, restart the vehicle to upstart the system.
entry.title: Availability and technical requirements
Customer privacy

entry.body:
The parking heater will not start in the following conditions:
• If the exterior temperature is above 15C.
• If the fuel level is too low.
• If the battery charge level is too low.

entry.body: When your subscription time expires you will receive a new warning saying “On Call Deactivated”. 14 days after the subscription time ran out the warning light will be shut off and the Volvo On Call unit is deactivated. Emergency service and automatic collision alert will continue to function. Contact your local dealer to renew your subscription.

entry.body: Yes. Use the assistance function in your Volvo On Call mobile app. For Andriod phones, this is found in the "Features" menu. For iOS phones, you access roadside assistance from the [check iPhone app] view.
entry.title: Can I access roadside assistance via the app?

entry.body: Yes. Enter the Journal log in your Volvo On call app, select the trip you wish to delete and choose the trash bin symbol. The selected trips will be deleted. Please note that all users connected to the account will be affected.
entry.title: Can I delete a trip from my journal log

entry.body: The trip information is sent approx. 30 seconds to one minute after the key has been removed. If you start the engine again within that time to continue driving (e.g. if you have turned off the engine at a red light), the trip that was ongoing before the engine was stopped will continue as soon as it restarts. In case of longer stops, e.g. refueling at a petrol station, two trips will be logged. You have the possibility to merge multiple trips into one via the app
entry.title: Will short stops be registrated?

entry.body: A maximum of ten app users (e-mail addresses and passwords) can be connected to one Volvo.
entry.title: How many app users can be connected to the same Volvo?

entry.body:
You can enter the wrong Volvo On Call PIN-Code 10 times in a row when trying to access services inside the app that require PIN-Code activation.
To be able to log in to your account again you need to recreate it by entering "Create account" from the first page of the mobile app. You can use the same user name and password as last time (you can also choose a new password).

entry.title: How many times can I enter the wrong PIN-Code?

As of model year 2012, no cost is added to your regular internet fee when using the remote heater start function in your Volvo On Call mobile app. If using the function abroad, roaming costs may be added, please check your phone manual for how to turn off roaming.

Cars of model year 2011 can access the remote heater function using SMS. The fee is based on your phone subscription and depends on whether you are located in your home country or abroad. Please contact your phone operator for price details.

entry.body: Yes. Technically the system will consider them as two separate trips. You have the option to merge them into one via the Volvo On Call app: Enter the journal log, select the trips you would like to group and choose the link-symbol.
entry.title: Will two trips be created if I stop at a petrol station?

entry.body:
Volvo On Call is a built-in assistance service featuring a groundbreaking mobile app that puts you in constant touch with your Volvo. Check your fuel, heat your car, lock and unlock the doors – with your smartphone you can communicate with your Volvo wherever you are. Read more about the features of the Volvo On Call mobile app. The service also includes roadside assistance, emergency help, theft notification and tracking of your car.  

Volvo was a pioneer when introducing the Volvo On Call system with automatic emergency services in 2001. The system consisted of an integrated telephone module along with two buttons, On Call and SOS. The hardware contains a GSM telephone module with both an external and back-up antenna, a back-up battery and connection to the vehicle. Volvo On Call is the start of a new era, where you’re always connected to your car in an intuitive and rewarding way.  

Get help fast whenever you need it

Volvo On Call is your lifeline when something goes wrong. For any urgent medical need or after a car accident, simply press the SOS button in the car and a trained Volvo On Call crisis manager will assist you and provide suitable help. The built in GPS-system will show your location and the position is transferred to the emergency center, keeping you safe at all times. If an airbag is deployed or a seatbelt pre-tensioner is activated, emergency assistance will find you even if you don’t press the SOS button. These services alone are enough reason to equip your car with Volvo On call.  

Equipped with Volvo On Call, you also have access to 24/7 roadside assistance.  A near-empty tank and no sight of a gas station? Did your car break down in the middle of nowhere? By pressing the On Call button in your car, you reach a Volvo On Call operator who will guide a recovery service all the way to your car.  

Read more about the Volvo On Call safety services and assistance. You can also contact your Volvo dealer for more information. 

Always secure

You can never completely protect yourself from carjackers. But with the Volvo On Call service, it will at least be much harder for a thief to get away with snatching your vehicle. Volvo On Call alerts you if your car is stolen and give you possibilities to track and immobilize the car remotely. In some cases, you may receive a significant discount on your car insurance policy if you have this service.  

Read more about the Volvo On call security services. You can also contact your Volvo dealer for more information.  

Please note that Volvo On call services available vary depending on country, phone and car model, see Availability and technical requirements for more information.
entry.title: What is Volvo On Call?

entry.body:
To be able to access certain Volvo On Call services such as the remote door unlock function, you need a 4-digit PIN-Code. You give your code of choice verbally to the Volvo On Call operator during the first call at your dealer. This code is not seen by anyone once it is entered.  It is used when you must identify yourself as the owner of the car during remote door unlock by an Volvo On call operator and in the case of theft notification services.  You should guard and remember the code just like any other PIN-Code. 

To login to your Volvo On Call mobile app account you also need a username (which is always your e-mail address) and a password of your choosing, this should be 6-20 characters and contain at least one numeric character and at least one alphabetic character,

Change PIN-Code, username and password

If the owner of the account wants to change the PIN-Code, he or she will need to contact the local dealer who will remove the old PIN-Code. To create a new PIN-Code, press the On Call button in your car. You will be provided support by an operator at the customer service center. Tell the operator the new PIN-Code you wish to use for your account. ​ 

You can change your username (e-mail address) and password directly from the app. Go to “Settings” and “My account”. 

Please note that users of Windows phones cannot change the login details from the app yet. You should contact your local dealer who will help you. 

Wrong password and PIN-Code

You can enter a faulty password 15 times before your account is locked. To be able to log in to your account again you need to recreate it by entering "create new account" in the mobile app. You can use the same log in and password as last time (You can also choose a new password). 

You can enter the wrong PIN-Code 10 times in a row before your account is locked when trying to access services inside of the app that requires this, e.g. create new user accounts. To be able to log in to your account again once it has been locked you need to recreate it by entering "Create new account" from the starting page in the mobile app. You can use the same log in and password as last time (You can also choose a new password if you prefer so). 

If you enter a faulty PIN-Code ten times in a row when trying to create new app accounts connected to your car, the possibility to add new accounts will be removed. Though, the existing accounts can still be used. To be able to create new accounts again you need a new PIN-Code.
entry.title: Manage your PIN code and app login

entry.body:
The Volvo On Call assistance services covers help in case of technical problems with your car, if you have ran out of fuel or have a flat tyre. Access roadside assistance by one of the following methods:
• Press the On Call button in your car.
• Use the Assistance function in the Volvo On Call mobile application. You access this from the start page.
• Dial the number corresponding to the Volvo On Call customer service center in your home country. Please see Volvo On Call customer service centers for contact details. The numbers are also found in your Volvo On Call manual.

You will be in contact with an operator at the Volvo On Call customer service center. The operator can access information about the status of your car (fuel level etc.) and your exact position. Together you will agree on suitable assistance (tow truck, fuel etc.) and the operator will send help to your location.

Please note that the operator will ask you if you are paying for the Volvo Roadside assistance (included during the warranty period, and can be extended with a renewable Volvo On Call subscription after that). If not, the operator will still send help to your location, but you will take on the costs for the assistance service yourself.
entry.title: Get roadside assistance

entry.body: The number of mobile phones connected to one Volvo On Call app account is unlimited.
entry.title: How many phones can be connected to one app account?

entry.body:
Using your mobile app, enter the "Settings" menu and choose "My Volvo". Press "Change owner" and enter your Volvo On Call PIN-Code. This will erase your service history, journal log entries and remote access accounts. Alternatively, contact your local dealer who will remove your service history and journal log entries.

If possible, inform your buyer that he/she should contact the dealer to reinitiate it. The Volvo On Call services will continue to function until the subscription end date.
entry.title: My car has Volvo On Call. What should I do before selling it?

entry.body: First, there is a 5 to 10 second delay for the instruction to be transmitted to the car via the GSM network. Then, for security reasons, the car will only unlock itself if the luggage compartment door handle is pulled.
entry.title: Nothing happens when I press unlock in the app, why?

entry.body: If the luggage compartment door has not been opened, the car will remain locked and the luggage compartment door will relock itself after 20 seconds. If the doors have been opened you will receive a Vehicle Unlocked notification after 30 minutes.
entry.title: If I unlock my car remotely and don't relock it, what happens?

Yes. You can tag your professional trips and export them into a spreadsheet compatible format.

Select the trips you wish to export and press the e-mail symbol. You then have the possibility to e-mail the information in one of the following formats: Excel-file, CSV-file or text. The file attached to the e-mail can be saved and opened in e.g Microsoft Excel, Google Spreadsheets or Open Office Spreadsheet.

entry.title: Can I use this function for my expense reports?

entry.body: Yes. You’ll need your mobile app login name and your mobile app password (which you entered while creating the first mobile app account).
entry.title: Can I use my Volvo On Call login on other phones?

entry.body: Yes. The VIN-number (vehicle identification number) is found in the car information menu in your Volvo On call mobile app.
entry.title: Can I see the VIN-number of my car in the app?

entry.body:
The password is required when logging in to your Volvo On Call app account. You selected the password yourself when you created the account. The password is 6-20 characters and contains at least one numeric character and at least one alphabetic character.

The Volvo On Call PIN-Code is the 4-digit code you gave verbally to the Volvo On Call operator during the first call at your dealer. This code is used when creating a Volvo On Call mobile app account, for remote door unlock and for theft notification services. You should guard and remember the code just like any other PIN-Code.
entry.title: What is the difference between password and PIN-Code?

entry.body:
There are three possible scenarios: 

  • All services will function as usual in countries where Volvo On Call is offered.  As of September 2012, these countries are: Sweden, UK, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Italy, Norway, Spain, France, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Russia, Denmark, Finland and Portugal.  (Outside of Europe Volvo On Call is offered in Brazil).  When you request assistance by pushing the OnCall or SOS buttons, you will be connected to the Volvo On Call center in the country where your car is located.
  • The Volvo On call emergency services are also offered in Poland, Republic of Ireland, The Czech Republic and Greece. If you push the SOS button, or in case of an automatic collision alert, when located in one of these countries, the Volvo On Call system will call the local emergency number (e.g. 112). This means that if, for example, you drive from Germany to Poland and push the SOS button, the Volvo On Call system will dial the Polish emergency number. Please note that the On Call button and the automatic theft notification will not work in these countries. Nevertheless, the car can be tracked into and out of the country and you will be able to unlock your car by calling the Volvo On Call customer service center and request a remote door unlock. 
  • Other European countries than the ones mentioned are not yet on the Volvo On call service provision list (e.g. Ukraine, Belarus and the Baltic and Balkan states). If the car drives into one of these countries, nothing will happen in case of an automatic collision or if the SOS is pressed. The On Call button and the automatic theft notification will not work. Nevertheless, the car can be tracked into and out of the country and you will be able to unlock your car by calling the Volvo On Call customer service center and request a remote door unlock.
entry.title: What happens if I drive into another European country?

entry.body: The Volvo On Call PIN-Code is required when creating a Volvo On Call mobile app account, for remote door unlock and for theft notification services.
entry.title: When do I have to use my Volvo On Call PIN-Code?

  • Imperial gallons, miles & mph
  • Litres, km & km/h
  • U.S. gallons, miles & mph
entry.title: How do I change the units shown in the app?

entry.body: Your phone will download and send data from and to the internet when using the Volvo On Call mobile app. Volvo Cars recommend you have an unlimited data plan. Note that when operating the application from abroad you may be charged roaming costs. Please consult your mobile network operator for more information.
entry.title: Will the app generate extra charge on my mobile phone bill?

entry.body: Volvo On Call cannot be ordered in retrospect since it requires special equipment in the car that needs to be installed when the car is manufactured.
entry.title: My Volvo is not equipped with Volvo On Call. Can I get it?

entry.body:
Please make sure of the following:
1) Your car is a model year 12 or beyond and is equipped with Volvo On Call.
2) Volvo On Call has been activated by your dealer at the time of delivery of your car (i.e. you have been asked to select a Volvo On Call PIN code).
3) Reinstall the app. Make sure that the car is in an open area with coverage, both to your phone and to your car. Follow the instructions to create an account.

This number can be used e.g. if you need roadside assistance, for unlocking your car remotely or to report a theft. The Volvo On Call center can also be accessed via the On Call button in your car and from the Volvo On Call app.
